It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests or rocky outcrops. Due to habitat loss, Pseudoclausia olgae is considered endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
